keyword: how many calories are in two scrambled eggs
title: How Many Calories Are in Two Scrambled Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in two scrambled eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Two Scrambled Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with 1 tsp butter total, no milk, cheese, or added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and ingredients; check labels or recipes when available.

quick_answer.text: Two scrambled eggs provide ~200 kcal and ~12 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 100 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What are the macros for two scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: ≈12.6 g protein, 16 g fat, 1.2 g carbs.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have more calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added cooking fat; plain scrambled is ~100 kcal vs. 78 kcal boiled per egg.

faqs.q: How does adding milk affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Adds ~10 kcal per tbsp per egg, plus minor carbs and protein.

faqs.q: Why is cholesterol high in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Eggs naturally contain cholesterol in the yolk; two eggs ≈400 mg.
